a(n=0).description: Returns the absolute difference of `N` and `n`.

c(n=1).description: Returns `N` rounded up to the nearest multiple of `n`.

e(n).description: Returns `N*(10**n)` (`N` multiplied by `10` raised to the power of `n`).

f(n=1).description: Returns `N` rounded down to the nearest multiple of `n`.

g().description: Returns the sign of `N`; `-1` if negative, `1` if positive, `0` if `N=0`, or `NaN` if `N=NaN`.

g(n=0).description: Returns the sign of `N-n`; `-1` if negative, `1` if positive, `0` if `N=n`, or `NaN` if `N=NaN` or `n=NaN`.

g(a/s).description: Returns the element or character in `a/s` at index `N`.

g(f).description: Returns the result of passing `N` though `f`.

i(s).description: Returns an `intervalID` and evaluates `s` as JavaScript every `N` milliseconds.

j(n=1).description: Returns `true` if `N` and `n` are co-prime, or `false` if not.

m(n,...,n?).description: Returns the minimum of `N` and the arguments passed.

o(n1=0,n2=1,f?).description: Returns the result of passing the integers in the sorted range `[n1,N)` (with step `n2`) through `f`.

p(n=2).description: Returns `N` raised to the power of `n`.

r(n=1).description: Returns `N` rounded to the nearest multiple of `n`.

s(n=10).description: Returns `N` converted from to a base-`n` string. `n` is limited to `2-36`, inclusive.

s(s/a).description: Returns the result of converting `N` to a base-`s/a` string. (e.g., `9.s(["a","b"])` = `"baab"`)

s(f).description: Returns the result of converting `N` to a string, passing it through `f` and then converting it back to a number.

s(x=10,f).description: Returns the result of converting `N` to a base-`x` string, passing it through `f` and then converting it back to a number.

t(f).description: Returns an `timeoutID` and executes `f` after `N` milliseconds.

v(n=2).description: Returns `1` if `N` is evenly divisible by `n`, or `0` if not.

w(n,...,n?).description: Returns the maximum of `N` and the arguments passed.

y(n=2).description: Returns the greatest common divisor of `N` and `n`.

z(n=2).description: Returns `N` divided by `n` and rounded down to the nearest whole number.

à(n?).description: Returns the number of combinations of an array of length `N`. If `n` is passed, returns the number of combinations of that array of length `n`.
Returns the number of permutations of an array of length `N`. If `n` is passed, returns the number of permutations of that array of length `n`.

â(x?).description: Returns the divisors of `N`, excluding `N` if `x` is truthy.

ì(f).description: Returns the result of converting `N` to an array of digits, passing it through `f` and then converting it back to a number.

ì(x=10,f).description: Returns the result of converting `N` to an array of base-`x` digits, passing it through `f` and then converting it back to a number.

î(s=\" \").description: Returns `s` repeated and sliced to length `N`.

ò(n1=0,n2=1,f?).description: Returns the result of passing the integers in the sorted range `[n1,N]` (with step `n2`) through `f`.

ó(n1=0,n2=1,f?).description: Returns the result of passing the integers in the sorted range `[N,N+n1)` (with step `n2`) through `f`.

ô(n1=0,n2=1,f?).description: Returns the result of passing the integers in the sorted range `[N,N+n1]` (with step `n2`) through `f`.

õ(n1=1,n2=1,f?).description: Returns the result of passing the integers in the unsorted range `[n1,N]` (with step `n2`) through `f`.

ö(n=1).description: Returns `n` random integers from the range `[0,N)` with `n` rounded up to the nearest whole number, if necessary. If `n=1` then the integer itself is returned.

ö(x).description: Returns a random permutation of the range `[0,N)`.
